message.content:
Title: Property Sale Contract

This Property Sale Contract (the "Contract") is made and entered into on this 15th day of September, 2023 (the "Effective Date"), between:

Seller:
Name: Hossam
Address: [Seller's Address]
City: [Seller's City]
Country: Egypt

Buyer:
Name: Ahmed
Address: [Buyer's Address]
City: [Buyer's City]
Country: Egypt

Hereafter collectively referred to as the "Parties."

1. Property Details:

1.1 Property Description:
- Address: [Property Address]
- City: [Property City]
- Country: Egypt

1.2 Property Title and Ownership:
The Seller warrants that they are the legal and rightful owner of the aforementioned property and have the authority to sell it. The Seller shall provide all necessary documentation to transfer the title and ownership to the Buyer upon full payment of the agreed-upon purchase price.

2. Purchase Price and Payment:

2.1 Purchase Price:
The agreed-upon purchase price for the property is [Purchase Price in Egyptian Pounds], payable as follows:

- Initial Deposit: [Amount of Initial Deposit in Egyptian Pounds] to be paid by the Buyer within [Number of Days] business days from the Effective Date.
- Remaining Balance: The balance of [Amount of Remaining Balance in Egyptian Pounds] shall be paid by the Buyer to the Seller no later than [Date] (the "Closing Date").

2.2 Method of Payment:
All payments must be made in Egyptian Pounds through a bank transfer or any other mutually agreed-upon method.

3. Closing and Transfer of Property:

3.1 Closing Date:
The transfer of the property's title and ownership shall take place on [Closing Date]. All necessary documents, including but not limited to the property's title deed, shall be handed over to the Buyer by the Seller.

3.2 Closing Costs:
All costs associated with the transfer of the property, including any applicable taxes, registration fees, or legal expenses required for the transfer, shall be borne by the Buyer.

4. Seller's Representations and Warranties:

4.1 Property Condition:
The Seller represents and warrants that, to the best of their knowledge, the property is free of any liens, encumbrances, or claims by third parties that may inhibit or prevent the transfer of the property's title and/or ownership.

5. Buyer's Inspection and Due Diligence:

5.1 Property Inspection:
The Buyer shall have the right to conduct a thorough inspection and due diligence of the property, including obtaining professional surveys, assessments, or reports, at their own expense. It is the responsibility of the Buyer to satisfy themselves of the property's condition and suitability before the Closing Date.

6. Default and Remedies:

6.1 Default by the Seller:
If the Seller fails to fulfill their obligations under this Contract, the Buyer may, at their discretion, seek legal remedies, such as specific performance or termination of this Contract.

6.2 Default by the Buyer:
If the Buyer fails to make payment as outlined in Section 2 or otherwise breaches any provision of this Contract, the Seller may terminate this Contract, retain any payments made by the Buyer, and pursue legal remedies available to them.

7. Governing Law and Jurisdiction:

This Contract shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of Egypt. Any disputes arising from or relating to this Contract shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in Egypt.

8. Entire Agreement:

This Contract constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes any prior agreements, understandings, or negotiations, whether oral or written, relating to the subject matter hereof.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Property Sale Contract as of the Effective Date.

Seller (Hossam):                           Buyer (Ahmed):

_________________________            _________________________
(Seller's Name)                                       (Buyer's Name)

_________________________             _________________________
(Date)                                                          (Date)
